com.impinj.octane

Class AutoStopConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.impinj.octane.AutoStopConfig

  • public class AutoStopConfig
extends java.lang.Object
    The ImpinjReader can be configured to stop inventory automatically based on several inputs including General purpose input (GPI) and time. This class holds the configuration for the Auto stop feature.

      • getMode

        public AutoStopMode getMode()
        Returns:
        the current auto stop mode for the device

      • setMode

        public void setMode(AutoStopMode mode)
        Parameters:
        mode - the desired auto stop mode for the device

      • getDurationInMs

        public long getDurationInMs()
        Returns:
        the current configured duration for the periodic auto stop mode

      • setDurationInMs

        public void setDurationInMs(long durationInMs)
        Parameters:
        durationInMs - the desired configuration for the periodic auto stop mode

      • getGpiPortNumber

        public int getGpiPortNumber()
        Returns:
        the current port number for the GPI auto stop mode

      • setGpiPortNumber

        public void setGpiPortNumber(int gpiPortNumber)
        Parameters:
        gpiPortNumber - the desired GPI port number for the periodic auto stop mode

      • getGpiLevel

        public java.lang.Boolean getGpiLevel()
        Returns:
        the configured GPI level that will trigger an auto stop when using the GPI auto stop mode.

      • setGpiLevel

        public void setGpiLevel(java.lang.Boolean gpiLevel)
        Parameters:
        gpiLevel - the desired GPI level that will trigger an auto stop when using the GPI auto stop mode.

      • getTimeout

        public long getTimeout()
        Returns:
        the current configured timeout for the auto stop. This applies only when the auto stop mode is GPI. A value of zero indicates and indefinite timeout

      • setTimeout

        public void setTimeout(long timeout)
        Parameters:
        timeout - the desired timeout for the auto stop. This applies only when the auto stop mode is GPI. A value of 0 indicates an indefinite timeout
